news.title: Mairead McGuinness pulls out of presidential race over health concerns
news.summary: McGuinness' departure leaves only one official candidate in the race, though Nutriband CEO Gareth Sheridan announced his bid for the presidency earlier this week, as discussed in his recent interview with Hot Press.

news.title: Ashnikko announces Dublin show
news.summary: Tickets for her Dublin gig go on sale August 21.

news.title: Netflix drops official season two trailer for Wednesday part two
news.summary: Part 2 of Wednesday will have a guest appearance from Lady Gaga

news.title: Newton Faulkner to release ‘What Took You So Long’ in partnership with Teenage Cancer Trust
news.summary: The double platinum artist is set to play across Ireland in November with dates in Belfast, Dublin and Cork.

news.title: Dublin City Council Dublin City Fleadh: Celebrating the rich tapestry of Irish traditional music in the heart of Smithfield Square
news.summary: For two days across Saturday 23rd & Sunday 24th August, from 12-6pm, the cobblestoned expanse of Smithfield Square celebrates Dublin’s vibrant tradition of Irish music, as the Dublin City Council Dublin City Fleadh returns for a much-anticipated fourth year.

news.title: The Maccabees' Orlando Weeks: "What's been such a pleasure is not feeling like we were towards the end of Maccabees, that all-or-nothingness that made it so claustrophobic"
news.summary: Ahead of their Dublin headliner this weekend, The Maccabees singer Orlando Weeks opens up about performing again after nearly a decade apart. Also discussed: chainsmoking with Jamie T, seven-year-old music critics and the unifying power of Radiohead.

news.title: Boachitta to release debut single and music video ahead of her new album
news.summary: Tickets for her single launch party are on sale now.

news.title: Mary Black, Chris O'Dowd, Siobhán McSweeney and more sign letter to Minister for Justice urging reunification of Gazan families "before it's too late"
news.summary: "We plead with you to make this an urgent priority and to take swift action to facilitate the evacuation of the parents, minor siblings, and adult dependent siblings of these sick children from Gaza to Ireland," the letter reads.

news.title: Live show dedicated to Thin Lizzy's Philip Lynott set to take place in Dublin
